item.title: Report E-2023100547
item.description:
Report E-2023100547

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: CARROLLTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 9, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the phosphoric acid-impacted roadway/trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, impacted dirt and damaged jug were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023100541
item.description:
Report E-2023100541

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: SAN ANGELO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 6, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon drum of UN3098 was damaged during transit and released approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of product to the trailer floor and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and sodium bicarbonate to remediate the UN3098-impacted impacted trailer interior and pavement. LSH personnel solidified and neutralized the damaged pail of product. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly vented drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023090479
item.description:
Report X-2023090479

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PADDED EXPRESS PACKAGE GOING TO SINGAPORE THAT WAS EMITTING A STRONG FUEL ODOR. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY AN 8 OUNCE FUEL SAMPLE IN A 12 OUNCE BOTTLE. THE SAMPLE HAD RELEASED ENOUGH FUEL VAPORS TO REMOVE THE LABEL FROM THE SAMPLE AND DAMPEN THE INNER PACKAGING. INNER DOCUMENTATION CONTAINED AN SDS SHOWING THE PRODUCT TO BE REGULATED AS DIESEL FUEL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1

  • Description: AFTER PRODUCT UNLOADED DRIVER ATTEMPTED TO DISCONNECT HOSE BEFORE DEPRESSURIZING HOSE. PRODUCT IN HOSE SPRAYED OUT AND ONTO DRIVER WHO WAS NOT WEARING REQUIRED PPE. DRIVER RINSED OFF AND COMPLETED DISCONNECTING HOSES. DRIVER FAILED TO REPORT INCIDENT AT TIME AND WENT HOME AFTER SHIFT. NEXT DAY DRIVER SOUGHT MEDICAL ATTENTION FOR REACTION ON SKIN. DRIVER HOSPITALIZED FOR SEVERAL DAYS THEN RELEASED FROM HOSPITAL.

item.title: Report X-2023091015
item.description:
Report X-2023091015

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-18
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Before inspecting the hazmat, I put on my hazmat safety gloves and made sure that nothing was leaking. When opening the box for further inspection, one of the glass liters was broken and lost all of the content that was inside, the other 3 glass liters had no damage. I grabbed the broken glass pieces with my gloves and threw them away after I took pictures for the report. Then obtained a large yellow barrel and put a blue hazmat bag inside to place the undamaged products in and placed in the hazmat cage until further instructions are given. DescribePack: This package was improperly handled which led to one of the glass liters breaking and losing all the content that was inside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: By the time I was inspecting the hazmat the liquid had already dried up but in case of further leakage that went unnoticed I placed a cardboard box underneath the original hazmat box.

item.title: Report I-2023090027
item.description:
Report I-2023090027

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NATX 302982 loaded with denatured alcohol was sloshing out of the top from under the dome lid when handled, Haz-Mat Special Services was contacted, after arriving on scene it was discovered that there was no gasket and the manway bolts were loose. Car was repaired and cleaned by Haz-Mat Special Services and released for movement.

item.title: Report I-2023090014
item.description:
Report I-2023090014

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1745 on 08/18/23 notification was received that tank car TILX 101860 was leaking product from the top and down the side of the car and onto the ground, the tank car was fully loaded with Sulfuric Acid, our contract Haz-Mat company (Haz-Mat Special Services) was notified and responded to the scene. Once they arrived it was discovered that the liquid load line bolts had not been fastened properly and flanges to not meet equally, HMSS was able to repair by reseating the flanges and re-torquing bolts, while pulling the top plug to the liquid line and re-sealing with proper TPFE tape. HMSS then cleaned the car with a solution of soda ash and water to neutralize car parts and side walls, as well as the ground.

item.title: Report I-2023080075
item.description:
Report I-2023080075

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-12
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1735 on 08/12/23 notification was received that tank car RCRX 1288 was leaking product from the top and down both sides, upon inspected the tank car was fully loaded with Hydrochloric Acid, our contract Haz-Mat company (Haz-Mat Special Services) was notified and responded to the scene. Once they arrived it was discovered that the Liquid Line Blind Flange had been left unfastened prior to shipping from the customer facility, HMSS was able to fasten the bolts evenly in a star pattern in order to secure the disc and prevent anymore product from leaking. HMSS then cleaned the car with a solution of caustic soda ash and water to neutralize car parts and side walls, as well as the ground and railroad base. HMSS was back on scene Monday morning 08/14/23 to assist with removing and disposing of contaminated rail, ties, plates, anchors and spikes.

item.title: Report I-2023090023
item.description:
Report I-2023090023

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10

  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/10/2023, an unapproved oxygen bottle was transported undeclared on DL1515 (arrived in DFW). The oxygen bottle was found to be inside of the pouch that was attached to a passengers' assistive device. The check valve of the oxygen bottle was attached to the unit. The DFW supervisor observed the oxygen bottle upon taking the assistive device to the jet way. See the attached picture.

item.title: Report I-2023090119

Report I-2023090119

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-24T00:32:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: ARMSTRONG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERIGAS PROPANE, L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AmeriGas vehicle traveling northbound on Hwy 77 at posted speed. Third party vehicle rear ended AmeriGas vehicle causing third party vehicle to be totaled. Due to impact, AmeriGas rear deck piping ripped or torn causing release of propane. Responding HazMat team was able to make safe releasing product and vehicles were towed from scene.
